item.title: Flight Management Computer Systems (FMCS) – Navigation Databases

remarks.para: May be out of currency provided:

numlitem.para: Current Aeronautical Charts are used to verify navigation fixes prior to dispatch,
Procedures are established and used to verify status and suitability of navigation facilities used to define route of flight, and
Approach navigation radios are manually tuned and identified.
Any re-route after initial clearance will require confirmation of latitude/longitude selection of affected waypoints by both crewmembers.
Both crew will independently verify the accuracy of waypoints listed along proposed route of flight using current aeronautical charts prior to blockout.
Approach navigation radios are manually tuned and identified prior to commencing approach.

note.para: RNP-10 airspace operations are not authorized for flights in excess of 12 hours after alignment without updating, and
Flights originating in BRNAV (RNP-5) airspace operations are not authorized for flights in excess of 2 hours after alignment without updating.

For operations to Central, South American and Mexico destinations only, the flight may not depart outbound domestic gateway with Navigation Databases out of date, but may continue series of flights for repair interval specified in the Repair Int Category section.

placard.para: Placard Captain’s CDU "NAV DATA BASE INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
